# writeRTFD(toFile:atomically:)

**Instance Method**

Writes the receiver’s text as RTF with attachments to a file or directory at `path`.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func writeRTFD(toFile path: String, atomically flag: Bool) -> Bool
```

## Discussion

Returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] on success and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] on failure. If `atomicFlag` is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], attempts to write the file safely so that an existing file at `path` is not overwritten, nor does a new file at `path` actually get created, unless the write is successful.

## Reading and writing RTF files

- **readRTFD(fromFile:)**: Attempts to read the RTFD file at the specified path.
- **rtfd(from:)**: Returns an NSData object that contains an RTFD stream corresponding to the characters and attributes within `aRange`.
- **rtf(from:)**: Returns an NSData object that contains an RTF stream corresponding to the characters and attributes within `aRange`, omitting any attachment characters and attributes.
